interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This change involves the addition of multiple words, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود", which clearly indicates a change across more than one word, fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This change involves the addition of multiple words, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود", which clearly indicates a change across more than one word, fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change from اتوا to اتو is an alteration in the spelling of the word, specifically the omission of the final alif, which is a characteristic of orthographic changes, similar to the example where the final alif in اتوا is omitted, resulting in اتو, without affecting the meaning or grammatical function of the word.
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

The change from ⸂فكلمهم ايضا يسوع⸃ to ⸂OMIT⸃ involves the omission of a major word, which is consistent with the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like "وقال → OMIT" where a single major word is added or omitted.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

The change from ⸂وقال⸃ to ⸂صوته وقال⸃ involves adding a new major word صوته, thus it cannot be classified under Orthography or Single_Minor_Word_Change, and since only one major word is added, it is not Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change from ⸂يمشي في الظلمه الي⸃ to ⸂يمشي فى الظلمه⸃ involves altering the spelling of the word "في" to "فى", which is a change in orthography, as it does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, similar to examples like اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم where the spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves altering the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a change to a minor word, specifically a preposition with a pronominal suffix, similar to the example given where الدهر بل تكون له is changed to الدهر بل تكون معه.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ involves altering the preposition "مع" to "له", which is a change to a minor word (a preposition), fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where "الدهر بل تكون له" is changed to "الدهر بل تكون معه".
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ involves substituting a single major word "الابد" with another major word "الدهر", where the roots of the words are different, fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves altering the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a change to a minor word, specifically a preposition with a pronominal suffix, similar to the example given where الدهر بل تكون له is changed to الدهر بل تكون معه.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل تكون له⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ involves modifying the verb form "تكون" to "يكون", which affects the person or number of the verb, making it a change to a minor word, specifically a modification in verb form, which fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ involves changing the preposition (with pronominal suffix) ل to a different form مع, which is similar to the example given where الدهر بل تكون له is changed to الدهر بل تكون معه, indicating a change to a minor word.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change from ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves adding the definite article ال to the word الدهر, which is a minor word change, specifically an addition of a definite article, similar to the example where اللاه is changed to الاله, and the example where لان ساعه لم is changed to لان الساعه لم, both of which are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves the substitution of the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له, which is a minor word change as per the definition, similar to the example where الدهر بل تكون له is changed to الدهر بل تكون معه.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The justification for this decision is that the change involves adding a single major word "نور" to the original text, which alters the meaning and structure of the sentence, fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The change from OMIT to الي involves adding a single major word, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like وقال → OMIT or OMIT → شيطان where a single major word is added or omitted.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

This change involves more than one word: the word اجاب is omitted and the word ف is added at the start, and the order of the words is changed, which matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to the example where "فقال لهم" is changed to "اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" which also involves multiple words being added.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The change from ايسوع to يسوع is a change in spelling or orthography, which includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors, and this example is similar to other examples given in the Orthography category, such as اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

This change involves substituting the conjunction و with the conjunction ف, which is a minor word change as per the definition, similar to the example where فقال is changed to وقال, both of which involve changing a conjunction.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

This change involves the addition of the word "اجاب" and the reordering of words, which affects more than one word, fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to the example where "فقال لهم" is changed to "اجاب يسوع وقال لهم".
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change from ⸂اجاب يسوع وقال لهم⸃ to ⸂اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم⸃ involves altering the spelling of "يسوع" to "ايسوع" and changing the conjunction "و" to "ف", however since the latter affects a minor word, and given that the former is purely an orthographic change, the overall change can still be classified under Orthography because the alteration of "يسوع" to "ايسوع" is an orthographic change and the change of "و" to "ف" is a change to a minor word, but considering the definition provided and similar examples, the most fitting category seems to be Orthography due to the nature of the changes involved.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The change from ⸂وانتم انما⸃ to ⸂انتم⸃ involves the omission of the minor word وان, which is similar to the example where وان is omitted from وان → ان, thus it fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

The justification for this decision is that the entire phrase "ايما تقضون" is a major word or phrase that conveys significant meaning, and its omission results in a substantial change to the sentence, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

This change is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the substitution of a minor word, specifically the verb form "تقضوا" which is a modification of the verb tense, and this type of change is characteristic of the Single_Minor_Word_Change category, similar to examples like "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" where the form of the verb is changed.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change from ama to wa is a change to a single minor word, specifically a conjunction, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like وان → ان where the conjunction و is added.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The change from واما to وان involves the substitution of a minor word (the conjunction و remains, but the following word changes from ama to ana), which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like اما الابن → واما الابن where a conjunction is added.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

The change from ⸂ليس ادين احد⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احدا⸃ involves the addition of a conjunction (ف) at the start and an alif of nasb is added to احد, both of which are considered minor word changes according to the given definitions, similar to the example where ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change from ⸂ليس ادين احد⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves adding a conjunction ف to the start, which is a minor word change, similar to examples like ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا where a conjunction ف is added at the start.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد
The change from ⸂ليس ادين احدا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احدا⸃ involves adding a conjunction ف to the start of the phrase, which is a minor word change, thus fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change from ⸂ليس ادين احدا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves adding a conjunction ف to the start of the phrase, which is a minor word change, similar to the example where ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا, and thus fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂فليس ادين احدا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves the removal of an alif of nasb from احدا, which is an alteration to the spelling or orthography of the word without affecting its meaning, fitting the definition of Orthography.
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂فليس ادين احدًا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves the removal of an alif of nasb, which is a change in orthography that does not affect the meaning of the word, similar to examples like "ليس ادين احدا → ليس ادين احد" where an alif of nasb is removed.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂لاني⸃ to ⸂هو لان⸃ involves the substitution of the single word لاني with two words هو لان, thus it affects more than one word and therefore fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change from ليست to ليس is a modification in the form of the verb, which falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a change to a minor word (in this case, a verb form) without altering the root of the word.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change from ليست to ليس is a modification in the form of the verb, which is considered a minor word change according to the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where ليست is changed to ليس.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change from ⸂ولكني⸃ to ⸂لكنى⸃ is an example of an orthographic change because the spelling of the word is altered by replacing و with ل but the overall meaning remains unaffected, similar to examples where the spelling of a word is standardized or corrected without changing its meaning or grammatical function.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The change from ⸂حق⸃ to ⸂OMIT⸃ involves omitting a single major word, which aligns with the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like "وقال → OMIT" where a single major word is added or omitted.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT
The change from ⸂حق⸃ to ⸂حق هي⸃ involves adding a minor word, which is the pronoun 'هي', this fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves the addition of a minor word.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change from ⸂انا⸃ to ⸂وانا⸃ involves the addition of a conjunction و, which is considered a minor word, making this a Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the given definitions and similar examples, such as "وان → ان" and "اما الابن → واما الابن".
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The justification for this decision is that the word نفسى is a major word and it is entirely omitted in the second reading, which matches the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change where a single major word is added or omitted.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change from على to لي involves a change to a single minor word, specifically a preposition, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where الدهر بل تكون له is changed to الدهر بل تكون معه, where the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

The change from ⸂على ذلك⸃ to ⸂لي وهو⸃ involves changing the major word 'ذلك' to 'لي', and also adding the major word 'هو', thus it affects more than one word and cannot be classified under Single_Major_Word_Change based on the definition alone, however considering all options it seems most fitting due to the fact that each word being altered or added has significance beyond what is defined as minor, hence it doesn't fit neatly into Single_Minor_Word_Change either, yet given the description it leans towards Multiple_Word_Changes but since both words have significance the alteration impacts the whole phrase significantly making the chosen category arguable but closest match.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change from ⸂لي ذلك⸃ to ⸂لي وهو⸃ involves replacing the major word "ذلك" with another major word "وهو", which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change as it involves changing a single major word to a different root word.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change from ⸂يسوع⸃ to ⸂ايسوع⸃ is an example of an orthographic change because an alif is added to the beginning of the word, which does not affect its meaning, similar to the example where ايسوع is changed to يسوع.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the alteration involves substituting a single minor word, specifically the conjunction "ف" with "و", which is a modification to a minor word as defined in the given categories, similar to the example where "فقالوا" is changed to "وقالوا" which also involves changing a conjunction.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change from ⸂كان يكلمهم⸃ to ⸂كلمهم⸃ involves the omission of the minor word "كان" which is a conjunction in this context, this fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a change to a minor word.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change from ساعته to ساعه is an alteration in the spelling of the word without affecting its meaning, specifically the removal of the letter ت, which is an example of an orthographic change as seen in examples like اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم where the spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم
The change from ساعته to الساعه involves adding the definite article ال, which is considered a minor word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

This change involves altering multiple words: "لان" is changed to "اذ", and "ساعه" is changed to "كانت", which fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as changes across more than one word, even if the changes are minor.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

The justification for this decision is that the root of the word بلغت is changed to اقتربت, which is a change to a single major word, similar to the example where اتت is changed to اقتربت, and this fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change from تكون to تكن is a modification within a single word, specifically affecting the root of the word, however since the change is limited to a single word and doesn't add, omit or substitute a completely different root word, it aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, especially considering the alteration doesn't introduce a new major word but rather adjusts the form of an existing one.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The reason for choosing Single_Major_Word_Change is that the root of the word is changed, specifically the verb اقتربت is changed to اتت, which is a change to a completely different word, fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example where اتت is changed to اقتربت.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

This change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is changed to "انطلق", "طلبوني" is changed to "طلبونى", and "في" is changed to "ولا". According to the definition, even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا
The change from ⸂وبخطاياكم⸃ to ⸂خطاياكم⸃ involves the omission of the preposition و, which is considered a minor word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

The change involves multiple words: the major word خطاياكم is changed to two words تجدونى and باثمكم, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to examples like "فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" where multiple words are added.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change from تموتون to تموتوا is a change in the form of the verb, specifically a change in the person or number, which falls under the category of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a modification to a minor aspect of a word without altering its root, similar to examples like تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.
The change from انطلق to اذهب involves changing the root of the word, which classifies it as a Single_Major_Word_Change, since the alteration affects a major word and the root is different.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

The change from اذهب to انطلق affects the root of the word, making it a change to a single major word, as seen in the example where يعتقكم is changed to ايعرفكم, the root of the verb is changed, and similarly, here the root of the word اذهب is changed to انطلق, hence it is a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

The reason for choosing Single_Major_Word_Change is that the root of the word "ليس" is changed to "لا", which is a different root, and also "تاتون" is changed to "تجون", which is also a change in the root of the word, however since "ليس" is a major word and its change is sufficient to categorize this as a Single_Major_Word_Change, even though there is another change.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

The change from ⸂ليس تقدرو تاتوا⸃ to ⸂ليس تقدرون تاتوا⸃ involves the modification of the verb form "تقدرو" to "تقدرون", which affects the number of the verb, making it plural. The change from شيطان to الشيطان involves adding the definite article ال to the major word شيطان, thus it is a Single_Major_Word_Change because the root of the word remains the same but the word itself has been altered by the addition of the definite article, similar to the example where بيت الكنز is changed to بيت القربان, however in that case the root of the word is changed whereas here the alteration is due to the addition of the definite article.
c.f. شيطان ➞ الشيطان

The change from فانت to وانت involves the addition of a conjunction و, which is considered a minor word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like وان → ان where the conjunction و is added.
c.f. فانت سامري ➞ وانت سامري
Multiple words are added.

This change involves the addition of two words, "اجاب ايسوع", which modifies the original text significantly, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word.
c.f. فقال ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال
The preposition (with suffix) لهم is added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start and the major word شيطان is omitted.

The change from ama to an is a change to a minor word, specifically a conjunction, and the change from فليس to ليس is also a change to a minor word, however since there are two changes, this initially seems like it should be categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes, but given that one of the changes is to a minor word and the other change is also to a minor word (and both changes affect the same root word), it fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change better because the changes do not affect the root of the words and are limited to parts of speech defined as minor.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ ان شيطان ليس فى

The change from شيطان to الشيطان is an example of an orthographic change because the addition of the definite article ال to شيطان does not affect its meaning or grammatical function, it merely standardizes the spelling, similar to examples like اللاه → الاله where the change is also orthographic.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ
The change from ⸂اما شيطان فليس في⸃ to ⸂اما شيطان فليس⸃ involves the omission of the minor word في, which is a preposition, thus it fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما شيطان فليس

The change from ان to اما involves the substitution of a minor word, specifically a conjunction, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like وان → ان where the conjunction و is added, or اما الابن → واما الابن where the conjunction و is added.
c.f. ان شيطان ليس فى ➞ اما شيطان فليس

The change from ⸂فاما انا فليس في⸃ to ⸂اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ⸃ involves the omission of the conjunction ف and the addition of the major word الشيطان, thus affecting more than one word, which aligns with the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. فاما انا فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

The change from ⸂اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ⸃ to ⸂اما شيطان فليس⸃ involves the omission of the minor word في, which is a preposition, and also the definite article ال from الشيطان, however since the definite article ال is considered a minor word, this change is still classified under Single_Minor_Word_Change because only one major word is affected and the changes are to minor words.
c.f. اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ ➞ اما شيطان فليس
The major word شيطان is added.
The major word التمس is omitted.

The change from ⸂التمس⸃ to ⸂اطلب⸃ involves changing the root of the word, which is a characteristic of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the verb is changed.
c.f. التمس ➞ اطلب

The justification for this decision is that ⸂اطلب⸃ is a major word that is completely omitted in the second reading, which aligns with the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change as an addition, omission, or substitution of a single major word, where the root of the word is different or the word itself is significantly altered, and examples like "وقال → OMIT" demonstrate omissions of major words.
c.f. اطلب ➞ OMIT
The preposition هو was added.

The change from هو to الذى involves changing the root of the word, which is a characteristic of a Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example where يعتقكم is changed to ايعرفكم, or where OMIT is changed to شيطان, both of which involve a change in the root word.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى

The change from ⸂هو الذي⸃ to ⸂الذي هو⸃ involves changing the order and roots of the words, with "هو" being replaced by "الذي" and "الذي" being replaced by "هو", thus it is a change of major words, hence it fits the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو

The justification for this decision is that 'ان' is a minor word, specifically a conjunction or particle, and its omission results in a change that fits within the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as seen in similar examples where minor words like 'ان' are added or omitted.
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

The change from الابد to الدهر involves changing the root of the word, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the verb is changed, or بيت الكنز → بيت القربان where the noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
